title: Reetika Hooda: India's New Wrestling Star Rises Amidst Turmoil
content:
Reetika Hooda, a quiet force on the wrestling mat, has become the first Indian woman to win the Under-23 World Wrestling Championship. This historic victory, achieved amidst a turbulent period for Indian wrestling, showcases Hooda's potential as a future Olympic star. 

The 21-year-old's journey from handball to wrestling, her dedication to training, and her recent gold medal at the National Games show her commitment to the sport.  Hooda's coach, Mandeep Singh, who has trained several Olympic medalists, believes her best is yet to come.

Despite the controversies surrounding the Indian Wrestling Federation, athletes like Hooda, Neha Sharma, and Nikita are proving that the future of Indian wrestling remains bright. Their dedication and talent offer a glimmer of hope for a sport grappling with its own challenges.
author: Samreen Razzaqui
